column4: Hrm I googled is there an easy way to load multiple distros with unetbootin
not that ive seen.. You would proberly have to manually configure the boot loader. and learn a bit about each disrto
Fair enough, I was just being lazy
i set up a thumbdrive with PuppyLinux and GeeXbox. :)

you would have to do some manual configuring of the syslinux (or was it grub) boot loader on the drive.. and perhaps some  work at 'installing'  to the THumbdrive, and archive the isntall somewhere else. install next OS.. and move the first one back....
unetbootin may erase the first. if you install another on top
and of course different disrtos install in different 'ways' to a thumb drive
thats the problem, how do I prevent it from doing so, I want ntpasswd and ophtcrack
you will have to install each OS and see how thy install and manually tweak things.
I cam
Er I can't even find a good how to on it for the love of GNU
no idea then..  Ive seen 2gb thumb drives for $5 a pop.. I aint going to be doing much Multi-intall-hacking on my thumbdrives any time soon.
i did get PuppyLinux+Geexbox on one THumbdrive however. and Ihad to manually edit the boot configs
what file did you edit?
depends on th boot loader its using.. syslinux has its syslinux.cfg
Hrm and whatabout the gui something.32 leave that alone?
no idea.. depends on the specific disrto you are messing with.
it pays to read the syslinux config/docs :) its a powerfull tool
Hrm I know both want their vesamenu.32
i think that some how gives syslinux a nice looking menu.
its proberly not needed.. if you set up a simple text menu
with reason if ya were there for its teething pains
yeah f12 on dells isn't it?
